statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Santa Clara trips Saint Mary's late, 71-70
article.headline: Santa Clara trips Saint Mary's late, 71-70
article.linkText: Santa Clara trips Saint Mary's late, 71-70
article.story: SANTA CLARA, Calif. -- Jared Brownridge scored on a layup with :07 left to give Santa Clara a 71-70 upset win over Saint Mary's Saturday night. Saint Mary's (21-8, 13-5) clinched 2nd place in the West Coast Conference Thursday, but now has lost two of its last three games. The Gaels open in the quarterfinal round Saturday in Las Vegas. Santa Clara (13-17, 7-11) opens the tournament Friday. Jarvis Pugh dunked to tie the game at 67-67 with 2:45 left, but Aaron Bright drilled a 3-pointer to give Saint Mary's a 70-67 lead. Brandon Clark drew a foul and converted two free throws with 1:01 left to cut the deficit to 70-69. Brad Waldow missed a layup with :32 left and Desmond Simmons missed a tip-in before Brownridge hit the game-winner. Brandon Clark scored 21 points and Brownridge and Denzel Johnson each added 17. Kerry Carter scored 19 points to lead Saint Mary's.
